trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> objects and provides a means of converting sets of <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref>-derived objects to <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref>-derived types.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> class with zero items in the collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> class by using the specified initial size.
The initial number of items in the collection.
The value of capacity is a hint only; it is not necessarily the maximum number of items created.
Adds an <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object to the <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> collection.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object to add to the collection.
identity is `null`.
Clears all <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> objects from the <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> collection.

Indicates whether the <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> collection contains the specified <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object to check for.
`true` if the collection contains the specified object.
identity is `null`.

Copies the <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> collection to an <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> array, starting at the specified index.

An <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> array object to which the <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> collection is to be copied.
The zero-based index in array where the collection is to be copied.
Gets the number of items in the <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> collection.
The number of <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> collection.
Gets an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> collection.
An enumerator for the <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> collection.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> collection is read-only.
Always returns `false`.
Sets or gets the node at the specified index of the <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> collection.
The zero-based index in the <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> collection.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> at the specified index in the collection.
If index is greater than or equal to the number of nodes in the collection, the return value is `null`.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object to remove.
`true` if the specified object was removed from the collection.
identity is `null`.
Converts the objects in the collection to the specified type.

Calling this method is the same as calling <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection.Translate(System.Type,System.Boolean)"></xref> with the second parameter set to `false`, which means that exceptions will not be thrown for items that fail conversion.
Order is preserved in the returned collection, That is, the first item in the returned collection corresponds to the first item in the source collection, and so on, for each item in the collection.
The items in the source collection are not required to be of the same type.
The type to which items in the collection are being converted.
A <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> collection that represents the converted contents of the original collection.
Converts the objects in the collection to the specified type and uses the specified fault tolerance to handle or ignore errors associated with a type not having a conversion mapping.
Order is preserved in the returned collection, That is, the first item in the returned collection corresponds to the first item in the source collection, and so on, for each item in the collection.
The items in the source collection are not required to be of the same type.
The type to which items in the collection are being converted.
A Boolean value that determines how conversion errors are handled.
If forceSuccess is `true`, conversion errors due to a mapping not being found for the translation result in a failed conversion and exceptions being thrown.
If forceSuccess is `false`, types that failed to convert due to a mapping not being found for the translation are copied without being converted into the collection being returned.
A <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> collection that represents the converted contents of the original collection.
Gets an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> collection.
An enumerator for the <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection"></xref> collection.
